thread.title: Egg producers struggle as prices drop amid overproduction
thread.title_full: Egg producers struggle as prices drop amid overproduction

author: Staff Writer
title: Egg producers struggle as prices drop amid overproduction
text: Egg producers struggle as prices drop amid overproduction 17 Dec 2024 | BY Staff Writer Egg producers struggle as prices drop amid overproduction 17 Dec 2024 | BY Staff Writer Sri Lanka's egg producers face losses due to excess production, with large eggs selling at Rs. 30-31, below the Rs. 34 production cost, Sri Lanka Association of Animal Production (SLAAP) President Ajith Gunasekera stated. The surge in production, driven by small and medium-scale farmers, has led to a price drop. Rising feed costs, which make up 75% of production expenses, further strain producers. Gunasekera warned that if this trend continues, producers may abandon egg farming, potentially causing shortages during the upcoming New Year season. He urged Government intervention to protect the industry.
